results.title: Switch on Bigga
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Electricity Commission of New South Wales (N.S.W.), Stanley Hawes, Lee Robinson and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division
results.brief_description: A unique look at the coming of electric power to a small rural district in NSW and the benefits derived from electricity by the farmer and his family. Includes a country style grand switching on ceremony.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Electricity Commission of New South Wales (N.S.W.), Stanley Hawes, Lee Robinson and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division

results.title: [VFL Grand Final, 1909: South Melbourne vs Carlton]
results.creator_credit: Charles Cozens Spencer and Spencers Pictures
results.brief_description: Coverage of the 1909 Australian Rules Football Grand Final played at the MCG between Carlton and South Melbourne. South Melbourne defeated Carlton 4.14 (38) to 4.12 (36), in front of a crowd of 37,759 people to win their first ever premiership. This is the earliest known surviving footage of a Victorian Football League (VFL) match.

results.title: Lily
results.creator_credit: Julie Money, Women's Film Unit and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A dramatic discussion starter which confronts the social issue of racial prejudice shown through the eyes of a young Asian Australian woman, Lily. The film has the advantage of being both open-ended and humourous, allowing students to identify with the characters within the film and working as a stimulus to class discussion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julie Money, Women’s Film Unit and Film Australia

results.title: Australian identity. Yrs 7-10
results.brief_description: A program presented in ten segments on the Australian identity. 1. What’s an identity? 2. What’s an Australian? 3. Popular legends. 4. Aboriginal identity. 5. People left out of our legends. 6. Defiance of authority. 7. The Anzac legend. 8. White colonial Australia. 9. Legends about women. 10. Changing national identity. Uses extracts from early Australian feature films and stills to focus on the question of who are Australians.

results.title: Ken Howard: saddler and harness maker
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the life and work of Ken Howard now one of the few remaining craftsmen in the art of saddlery, who uses traditional methods in preference to new technology.
results.description: Provides an insight into the life and work of Ken Howard now one of the few remaining craftsmen in the art of saddlery, who uses traditional methods in preference to new technology.

results.title: Artisans of Australia
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Pamela Paddon and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A four part tape that features master stonemason George Proudmen, moulder Jack Thomas, stained glass artist Kevin Little and axemen Bill Boyd and Mark Gardner at work during conservation and restoration work on National Estate places such as Coolamine Homestead, Garrison Holy Trinity Church and the Sydney Technical College at Ultimo.

results.title: Populations
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Ecology Series”.
Describes most of the principles that cause animal and plant populations to look and behave as they do. Notes the constant change of populations, why this happens and how plants and animals take steps to ensure their survival. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Cricket: Australian style
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A documentary on cricket as it is played in Australia in 1974. Offers highlights from a match between Australia and New Zealand and presents comments about the game by the then Australian captain Ian Chappell.

results.title: Australian report
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, Keith Gow, David Eastman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A lighthearted look at Australia in 1973 - its history, industry and tourist attractions. Commments upon the high degree of urbanisation, the enormous mineral reserves and industrial growth and the opportunities which exist for vacationers in both rural and coastal areas. Also looks at the breakdown of isolation through instant electronic communications and air travel. No other credits available.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Hart, Keith Gow, David Eastman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Australian army at war 1939-1945 (Episode 2)
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “War Experience”.
Uses actual newsreel footage to record the Australian soldier’s participation in the Second World War. Covers fighting in Libya, Greece, Crete, Syria and Tripoli, and the Singapore, New Guinea and Borneo campaigns.
